证据片段: At low applied stresses (that is, below the unirradiated flow stress of wellannealed material) he suggested [4] that the creep is primarily due to the stress-induced preferred orientation and growth of vacancy or interstitial loops or both.

证据片段: At somewhat higher stresses the creep rate is believed to be controlled by the glide and climb of edge dislocations [4].

证据片段: The primary obstacles to the glide of dislocations, after moderate radiation exposures (at temperatures $< 0 . 3 ~ T _ { m }$ ) are believed to be the radiation-produced depleted zones [7].

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_023_chunk1
证据片段: At stresses up to the post-irradiation-hardened flow stress, the creep rate is controlled by climb to escape the depleted zones

证据片段: Dollins [9] proposed a hightemperature theory which allowed vacancy boil-off and migration as well as interstitial migration and his model is consequently applicable in the temperature range of most interest for the creep of structural materials in operating reactors

证据片段: Figure 5 shows the predicted dependence of the creep rate on the temperature for several different neutron fluxes. At high temperatures the predicted strain rate increases rapidly with temperature due to a rapid decrease with temperature in the depleted zone density and increased self-diffusion. At temperatures below about 300°C the zone density and hence creep rate are very little dependent upon temperature.
